Criminal Rights: Evidence : Regulates searches and seizures, particularly in criminal investigations. May also prohibit the admission of involuntary confessions, or other suspect forms of evidence.
Political Rights: Reputation : Grants individuals the right to protect themselves against libel or slander.
Group Rights: Equality : Guarantees individuals equality before the law.
Economic Rights: Fair Compensation : Guarantees just, fair, or equal payment for work.
Social Rights: Benefits of Science : Grants individuals the right to enjoy the benefits of scientific progress.
Aspirational Rights: Human Dignity : "Dignity of man" or "human dignity" mentioned in the constitution. Often used as a motivation or justification for constitutional provisions.

Criminal Rights: Pre-Trial Release : Grants individuals charged with crimes the right to be released until time of trial. Release may be conditional on a bond, or other requirements.
Political Rights: Freedom of Religion : Grants individuals the right to hold and practice religious beliefs.
Group Rights: Gender Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of gender, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of gender.
Economic Rights: Unions : Grants individuals the right to form trade unions.
Social Rights: Shelter : Grants individuals the right to adequate shelter or housing.
Aspirational Rights: Indigenous Voting : Specifically protects voting rights for indigenous peoples.

Criminal Rights: Unjustified Restraint : Protects individuals from arbitrary detention or unjustified arrest. Sometimes known as habeas corpus.
Political Rights: Church/State Relationship : Guarantees some degree of separation between church and state.
Group Rights: Nationality Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of nationality, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of nationality.
Economic Rights: Strike : Grants individuals the right to strike. May also include protection for strikers' jobs or income.
Social Rights: Marriage : Grants individuals the right to marry. May be limited to heterosexual couples.
Aspirational Rights: Indigenous Representation : Grants indigenous people special representation in the central government. For example, may include a seat quota in the national legislature.

Criminal Rights: Appeal : Allows individuals to appeal unsatisfactory judicial decisions to a higher court
Political Rights: Expropriation of Property : Prohibits the government from taking private property without compensation.
Group Rights: Origin Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of country of origin, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of country of origin.
Economic Rights: Leisure : Grants individuals the right to vacations or weekly holidays.
Social Rights: Found Family : Grants individuals the right to commit to one another and raise a family.
Aspirational Rights: Form Indigenous Political Parties : Specifically protects right of indigenous peoples to form political parties.

Criminal Rights: Due Process : Entitles defendants to have their cases heard according to legal procedure.
Political Rights: Life : Grants individuals the right to life. May or may not reference rights of the unborn.
Group Rights: Racial Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of race, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of race.
Economic Rights: Standard of Living : Grants individuals the right to a minimum standard of living. Often linked to guarantees of human dignity.
Social Rights: Matrimonial Equality : Grants both spouses the same rights in marriage and family law.
Aspirational Rights: Indigenous Tax Exemption : Exempts indigenous people from taxation.

Criminal Rights: Witnesses : Grants defendants the right to examine or confront the prosecution's witnesses.
Political Rights: Slavery : Forbids ownership of human beings.
Group Rights: Language Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of language, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of language.
Economic Rights: Transfer Property : Grants individuals the right to freely transfer property.
Social Rights: Civil Marriage : Recognizes civil marriages, or religious marriages performed with a state license.
Aspirational Rights: Indigenous Exemption for Illegal Activities : Allows indigenous people to participate in certain activities illegal for non-indigenous groups.

Criminal Rights: Ex Post Laws : Prohibits laws that retroactively criminalize individual actions, or retroactively alter the penalties for existing crimes.
Political Rights: Movement : Grants individuals the right to travel within or out of the state.
Group Rights: Religious Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of religion, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of religion.
Economic Rights: Form Business : Grants individuals the right to conduct or establish businesses.
Social Rights: Health : Grants individuals the right to health. May also include a state obligation to provide healthcare.
Aspirational Rights: Indigenous Internal Governance : Grants indigenous people special rights to internal governance.

Criminal Rights: Fair Trial : Provides individuals the right to a fair trial. Fair trials often require a public hearing and judgment by a competent and impartial jury.
Political Rights: Opinion : Grants individuals freedom of opinion, thought, or conscience. Distinct from freedom of expression.
Group Rights: Sexual Orientation Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of sexual orientation, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of sexual orientation.
Economic Rights: Consumer Rights : Grants special rights to consumers. May include protection from harmful products or unethical business practices.
Social Rights: Privacy : Forbids government intrusion into individuals' property, persons, or communications without proper authorization.
Aspirational Rights: Provide Work : Obliges state to provide work.

Criminal Rights: Speedy Trial : Provides individuals the right to a speedy trial.
Political Rights: Expression : Grants individuals the right to express themselves.
Group Rights: Age Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of age, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of age.
Economic Rights: Social Security : Social security mentioned. Reference may be general, or may specifically include a national pension scheme.
Social Rights: Free Education : Obligates the state to provide free education. May only apply up to a certain age or level of educational attainment.
Aspirational Rights: Cultural Rights : Establishes the right of individuals to practice their culture. May also require the state to protect or promote cultural rights.

Criminal Rights: Public Trial : Provides individuals the right to a public trial
Political Rights: Petition : Grants individuals the right to petition the government.
Group Rights: Disability Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of disability, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of disability.
Economic Rights: Support for Elderly : Obligates the state to provide financial support to elderly persons.
Social Rights: Academic Freedom : Guarantees academic freedom. Usually includes the right to publish and teach freely.
Aspirational Rights: Information : Grants individuals the right to view government files or documents. Often restricted to information about oneself, or information of general public interest.

Criminal Rights: Double Jeopardy : Prohibits the state from charging an individual with a crime for which they have already been acquitted.
Political Rights: Press : Grants individuals the right to free expression in all forms of media.
Group Rights: Skin Color Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of skin color, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of skin color.
Economic Rights: Support for Unemployed : Obligates the state to provide financial support to unemployed persons.
Social Rights: Access to Higher Education : Grants individuals equal access to higher education. May be limited by aptitude tests.
Aspirational Rights: Self-Determination : Grants groups of individuals the right to self-determination. May reference the nation as a whole, or specific groups of individuals.`

Criminal Rights: Self-Incrimination : Grants accused individuals the right to refuse questions that would confirm that individual's guilt.
Political Rights: Assembly : Grants individuals and groups the right to assemble in public places for legal purposes. Often linked with the right to protest.
Group Rights: Creed Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of creed, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of creed.
Economic Rights: Support for Disabled : Obligates the state to provide financial support to disabled persons.
Social Rights: Victim's Rights : Grants the victims of crimes special rights in the justice process. Examples include restitution, attendance at the trial, or opportunity to speak at the trial.
Aspirational Rights: Development of Person : Grants individuals the right to develop and express their own personality.

Criminal Rights: No Punishment Without Law : Protects individuals from being prosecuted for actions that were not crimes at the time they were committed.
Political Rights: Association : Grants individuals the right to enter voluntary associations.
Group Rights: Social Status Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of social status, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of social status.
Economic Rights: Support for Children : Obligates the state to provide financial support to children or orphans.
Social Rights: Juvenile Criminal Rights : Grants juveniles special protections in the criminal justice system. These protections may include special courts, sentencing rules, or detention centers.
Aspirational Rights: Environment : Obligates both citizens and the state to protect or preserve the environment.

Criminal Rights: Capital Punishment : Forbids the state from imposing the death penalty.
Political Rights: Conscientious Objectors : Grants religious or ethical objectors an exemption from combat duty. May require noncombat service instead.
Group Rights: Financial Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of property ownership, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of property ownership.
Economic Rights: Property : Grants individuals and corporations the right to own property, or general protection of property ownership.
Social Rights: Renounce Citizenship : Grants individuals the right to renounce their citizenship.
Aspirational Rights: Arts : References artists or art. May require the state to support the arts.

Criminal Rights: False Imprisonment : Provides right of compensation or remedy for unjustified imprisonment, or imprisonment made in error.
Political Rights: Arms : Grants individuals the right to possess firearms and other weapons. May be subject to restrictions on use, transportation, or type of weapon.
Group Rights: Tribe/Clan Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of tribe or clan, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of tribe or clan.
Economic Rights: Occupation : Grants individuals the freedom to choose their occupation without government interference.
Social Rights: Birthright Citizenship : Provides right to citizenship upon birth to certain individuals. This right is usually subject to certain requirements, such as location of birth or parents' citizenship status.
Aspirational Rights: Language Protection : Grants individuals the right to use their native language.

Criminal Rights: Presumption of Innocence : Requires criminal defendants to be viewed as innocent until proven guilty. This requirement places the burden of proof on the prosecution.
Political Rights: Form Parties : Protects right to form or join political parties.
Group Rights: Party Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of party, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of party.
Economic Rights: Safe Working Environment : Grants individuals the right to a safe working environment. May include government obligation to provide safe working conditions.
Aspirational Rights: Overthrow Government : Grants citizens right to depose the government under certain circumstances.

Criminal Rights: Torture : Forbids the state from torturing individuals. Torture may be allowed during times of war or crisis.
Political Rights: Suffrage : References expansion of voting rights to new groups.
Group Rights: Parentage Non-Discrimination : Specifically protects certain rights on basis of parentage, or general reference to non-discrimination on basis of parentage.
Economic Rights: Child Labor : Protects children against exploitation in the workplace. May include special protections for child workers or a ban on child labor.
Aspirational Rights: Childrens' Rights : Guarantees certain rights for children. Examples include state-provided healthcare or education.

Criminal Rights: Cruel and Unusual Punishment : Forbids cruel, inhuman, or degrading treatment.
Economic Rights: Free Market : Protects individuals and corporations from price-fixing, monopolies, and other anti-competitive strategies.

Criminal Rights: Asylum : Obligates the state to offer assistance to stateless individuals or refugees.
Economic Rights: Debtors' Rights : Provides special protection to individuals who cannot meet their financial obligations.

Criminal Rights: Amparo : Gives citizens the right to request judicial review for government violations of their rights.
Economic Rights: Intellectual Property : General reference to intellectual property rights.

Criminal Rights: Extradition of Criminals : Provides special procedures for extradition of criminals to other states.
Trial in Native Language : Grants individuals the right to a trial in their native language, or the right to an interpreter during the trial.
Jury : Grants individuals the right to trial by jury.
Counsel : Grants accused individuals the right to legal counsel.
Corporal Punishment : Forbids the state from inflicting physical punishments such as whipping.
